cont.entity_a: Autofocus stopped working in less than a year. Autofocus is problematic in less than bright light. Autofocus is not the greatest but manual focus works fine. Autofocus is slow and not suitable for fast-moving sports. Autofocus is slightly slow but manageable. Autofocus is slow and noisy.
cont.entity_b: Fast and accurate focus. Fast focus and good for wide angle shots.

cont.entity_a: Warranty not available due to purchase from unauthorized seller. Tamron warranty repair service is efficient but shipping is at customer's expense.
The telephoto macro function is especially liked. Macro function is great. Good macro capability for the cost.
The lens is solid and well-built. Lens body is light yet solidly built.
cont.entity_b: Solid build with metal and glass construction. Heavy and not suitable for handheld use without stabilization.

cont.entity_a: The picture quality is excellent. The lens provides excellent clarity for the price. Photo quality is very good in bright daylight.
cont.entity_b: Great image quality for landscapes and night scenes. Sharp photos and good field of view. Solidly built and great image quality.

cont.entity_a: Good value for a 70-300mm lens compared to expensive Sony lenses.
cont.entity_b: Not as good as higher-priced lenses.

cont.entity_a: Noisy and slow operation, not suitable for astrophotography. The focal ring is loose and slips. Lens creep is noticeable when pointed upward.
The lens is lightweight and less expensive.
cont.entity_b: Heavy and not suitable for handheld use without stabilization.

cont.entity_a: The lens is not as fast as a $700 model but still performs well.
No image stabilization but still produces great pictures. Image stabilization is absent, requiring a tripod for low-light shots.

cont.entity_b: Images are very sharp with slight distortion correctable in post. Sharp photos and good field of view. Takes sharp pictures even in low light.

cont.entity_a: Lens is not practical for low-light photography without a tripod.
cont.entity_b: Great in low light with vivid color and sharpness at f/2.8. Excellent for landscape and architecture photography. Takes sharp pictures even in low light. Great for tight spaces and low light situations.
Barely perceptible barrel distortion on crop sensor cameras. Slight distortion but manageable with photo software.
Functions like a 32mm, making it versatile for photo and video. Very versatile despite fixed focal length.
Colors can appear lifeless and burnt-out.
